result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darnell Nelle Long

records.addlTxt: Due to court scheduling, Case moved from 12/20/2022 at 9:00 am to 12/15/2022 at 11:00 am by zoom.  Parties notified by email.

Defendant Darnell Nelle Long appeared by video.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted appeared by video for Darnell Nelle Long.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing hearing date.  Victim appeared by zoom and addressed no contact order.  Court will allow third party contact for purposes of childcare.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. 

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with K.J.B
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Darnell Nelle Long appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Colleen Cullen appeared by video for Darnell Nelle Long. Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Skwierawski, Branch 41.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
